examples: under control

definitions.text: a relation of constraint of one entity (thing or person or group) by another
examples: measures for the control of disease
they instituted controls over drinking on campus

definitions.text: (physiology) regulation or maintenance of a function or action or reflex etc
examples: the timing and control of his movements were unimpaired
he had lost control of his sphincters

definitions.text: a standard against which other conditions can be compared in a scientific experiment
examples: the control condition was inappropriate for the conclusions he wished to draw

definitions.text: the activity of managing or exerting control over something
examples: the control of the mob by the police was admirable

definitions.text: the state that exists when one person or group has power over another
examples: her apparent dominance of her husband was really her attempt to make him pay attention to her

definitions.text: discipline in personal and social activities
examples: he was a model of polite restraint
she never lost control of herself

definitions.text: great skillfulness and knowledge of some subject or activity
examples: a good command of French

definitions.text: a mechanism that controls the operation of a machine
examples: the speed controller on his turntable was not working properly
I turned the controls over to her

definitions.text: a spiritual agency that is assumed to assist the medium during a seance
the economic policy of controlling or limiting or curbing prices or wages etc.
examples: they wanted to repeal all the legislation that imposed economic controls

definitions.text: exercise authoritative control or power over
examples: control the budget
Command the military forces

definitions.text: lessen the intensity of; temper; hold in restraint; hold or keep within limits
examples: moderate your alcohol intake
hold your tongue
hold your temper
control your anger
do not operate machinery after imbibing alcohol
control the lever

definitions.text: control (others or oneself) or influence skillfully, usually to one's advantage
examples: She manipulates her boss
She is a very controlling mother and doesn't let her children grow up
The teacher knew how to keep the class in line
she keeps in line

definitions.text: check or regulate (a scientific experiment) by conducting a parallel experiment or comparing with another standard
examples: Are you controlling for the temperature?

definitions.text: verify by using a duplicate register for comparison
examples: control an account

definitions.text: be careful or certain to do something; make certain of something
examples: He verified that the valves were closed
See that the curtains are closed
control the quality of the product

definitions.text: have a firm understanding or knowledge of; be on top of
examples: Do you control these data?
